title: Password passed incorrectly to external application when using the ^(caret) character
author: glennss
body_snippet:
## Expected Behavior
Launch external application and pass the password using the %Password" argument

## Current Behavior
When a password that includes the ^(caret) character is used a duplicate is passed i.e pass^ord becomes pass^^ord

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
Setup and external application as normal, in the arguments tab, use the %Password% argument. try a password that includes a caret.

## Context
Trying to setup HP iLO Remote console and pass in %Username% %Hostname% and %...

comments.snippet: This does appear to be the case with all the argument fields when using the caret symbol
comments.author: glennss

comments.snippet:
The caret (`^`) symbol is used for metacharacter escaping. For example, if you want to explicitly supply the string `%password%` to the external app instead of its value, you can do this using `^%password^%`.

Use an exclamation mark to disable metacharacter escaping and argument splitting, for example `%!password%` or `%!userfield%`.

In mRemoteNG, press F1 and click _External Applications_ for more info.
